availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Campbell (Webster County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, physician and farmer. Gallatin, Sumner County, Tennessee native. Married to Albina King Campbell in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on July 5, 1853. Father of John Campbell, Virginia Campbell, Samuel Campbell, George Campbell, and Mary Campbell. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Webster County 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 618.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 486A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 4, p. 233A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994058, Hopkins County Marriages.
"George W. Campbell (1822-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41028264, accessed July 26, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41028264/george-washington-campbell.
